snippet: The Susan G. Komen for the Cure foundation apologized for its decision to cut grants to Planned Parenthood for cancer screening and said it would restore the funding.
abstract: Susan G Komen for the Cure foundation apologizes for its decision to cut grants to Planned Parenthood for breast cancer screening and says it will restore the funding; reversal follows the deluge of public outrage from online, within the foundation's own ranks and in Congress over the original move to cut off Planned Parenthood, and comes alongside growing consensus that the Komen foundation has no place in partisan battles over abortion.

byline.original: By PAM BELLUCK, JENNIFER PRESTON and GARDINER HARRIS

lead_paragraph: The Susan G. Komen for the Cure foundation apologized for its decision to cut grants to Planned Parenthood for cancer screening and said it would restore the funding.

headline.seo: Komen Reverses Stance on Planned Parenthood Grants
headline.main: Cancer Group Backs Down on Cutting Off Planned Parenthood
headline.print_headline: Ban Is Reversed By Cancer Group

keywords.value: Komen, Susan G, for the Cure
keywords.name: organizations
